title: how do I move a file from one folder to another in WSL?

parts: how do I move a file from one folder to another in WSL?

In WSL (Linux), you move files with `mv` (move).

### Basic move
```bash
mv /path/to/source/file /path/to/destination/folder/
```

Example:
```bash
mv ~/Downloads/report.csv ~/projects/myapp/
```

### Move and rename at the same time
```bash
mv ~/Downloads/report.csv ~/projects/myapp/report_old.csv
```

### Move an entire folder
```bash
mv ~/oldfolder ~/newparentfolder/
```

### If the destination already has a file with the same name
- It will be overwritten *without prompting* in many setups. To be safer:
```bash
mv -i sourcefile /dest/folder/
```
(`-i` asks before overwrite)

### Moving between Windows and WSL paths
- Your Windows drives are usually mounted under `/mnt`:
  - `C:` → `/mnt/c/`
  - `D:` → `/mnt/d/`

Example (move from WSL home to Windows Desktop):
```bash
mv ~/notes.txt /mnt/c/Users/<YourWindowsUser>/Desktop/
```

If you tell me the exact source and destination paths you’re using (and whether they’re on Linux filesystem or under `/mnt/c`), I can give you the exact command.
